intro: Cyphostemma curvipodum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique appearance and growth habit make it a notable species in its native range.
